doc: ASSOC <.ext>: Displays or modifies file extension associations.
ATTRIB [+R | -R] [+A | -A] [+S | -S] [+H | -H] [<File>]: Displays or changes file attributes.
BCDEDIT /set <identifier> <setting>: Sets properties in boot database to control boot loading.
CACLS <File> [/T] [/E] [/C] [/G user:perm] [/R user] [/P user:perm]: Displays or modifies access control lists (ACLs) of files.
CHKDSK <Drive> /F: Checks a disk and displays a status report.
COMP <File1> <File2>: Compares the contents of two files or sets of files.
COPY <Source> <Destination> [/A | /B] [/V] [/N] [/Y | /-Y]: Copies one or more files to another location.
DATE [MM-DD-YYYY]: Displays or sets the date.
DEL <File>: Deletes one or more files.
DIR [<Directory>] [/B] [/O[[:]-]<SortOrder>] [/S]: Displays a list of files and subdirectories in a directory.
DISKPART: Displays or configures disk partitions.
DOSKEY /REINSTALL: Edits command lines, recalls Windows Command Prompt commands, and creates macros.
ECHO <Message>: Displays messages or turns command echoing on or off.
EXIT: Quits the Windows Command Prompt.
FC <File1> <File2>: Compares two files or sets of files and displays the differences between them.
FIND "<Text>": Searches for a text string in a file or files.
FINDSTR /C:"<String>" <File>: Searches for strings in files.
FOR %variable IN (<Set>) DO <Command>: Runs a specified command for each file in a set of files.
FORMAT <DriveLetter>: /FS:<FileSystem> [/Q]: Formats a disk for use with Windows.
FSUTIL <Command>: Displays or configures the file system properties.
FTYPE <FileType>=<CommandString>: Displays or modifies file types used in file extension association.
GOTO :<Label>: Directs the Windows Command Prompt to a labeled line in a batch program.
HELP [<Command>]: Provides Help information for Windows Command Prompt commands.

ICACLS <FileName> [/T] [/Q] [/C] [/L] [/SETOWNER user[/T]] [/GRANT[:r] user:perm] [/DENY user:perm] [/REMOVE[:[r]] user[:[r]] [...]]: Display, modify, backup, or restore ACLs for files and directories.
IF <Condition> <Command>: Performs conditional processing in batch programs.
LABEL <Volume> <Label>: Creates, changes, or deletes the volume label of a disk.
MD <DirectoryName>: Creates a directory.
MKDIR <DirectoryName>: Creates a directory.
MKLINK <Link> <Target> [/H] [/J]: Creates a symbolic link.
MODE <Device> [<Status>]: Configures a system device.
